Manx: Troor Tromode
(carr: 'Brig Lily')
Ayns y vlein kiare feed as hoght
Va Mannin heese, v'ee ayns stayd boght,
Roosteyryn cheet veih gagh boayl quaagh
Dy chur nyn Ellan sheese sy laagh.
Va argid dooint ayns kishtaghyn
Dy yannoo foays da gombeenyn
As paart jeh'n theay dyn thie erbee,
Va coayl nyn spyrryd ayns dobberan dree.
Ren Laa Tynvaal cur aggle er sleih,
Veagh Mannin stroiet ec deiney creoi,
Agh gagh red mie fy yerrey hoal,
Sidooryn Hostyn dy chooilley voayl.
Va Yernee ayns Rhumsaa reeoil
Va baghey ayns shen dy braew sheeoil,
Agh ren ny meoiryn-shee cheet
stiagh
Notes: Left-aligned, unlike the rest of the text

Manx: Dy hauail Mannin veih baase as cragh.
Shenn Yernagh goit ec meoiryn-shee
Nagh ren rieau toiggal red erbee,
Thie raipit seose ec blebbyn boght
Fardailagh shirrey son y loght.
FSFO ry akin heose
FSFO ry akin heese
FSFO dy chooilley voayl,
Cre'n ferg t'ayns ny lettyryn doal.
Hoig Manninee dooie ny lettyryn shen
Va jannoo craid er aght cho glen
Jeh deiney berchagh, creoi as jooigh,
Lurg pooar as argid v'ad pandoogh.
Gawne, Sheard as Joughin, slaynt as shee,
Hug bree as niart da Manninee,
Ren cur ad hene myr oural losht
As gra rooin ooilley 'Vel shiu dooisht?'
Eisht, Troor Tromode, v'ad goit ayns shen,
As ayns pryssoon t'ad tannaghtyn,
Cooinsheanse yn Ellan ayns nyn gree,
Dy niartagh bree ny Manninee.
Brian y Stoyll
